conclusion: Analyze the p-V diagram of an ideal gas to compare internal energy at states a and c.
State a is at the bottom of the curve, and state c is at the top of the curve on the p-V diagram.
Understand the p-V diagram shows relationship between pressure and volume of an ideal gas.
Internal energy of an ideal gas is related to its volume and temperature.
In an adiabatic process, internal energy remains constant; in an isochoric process, internal energy changes.
Internal energy at state a and state c will be the same because they are both at the same temperature.
Internal energy at state c is higher than at state a because the gas expands from state a to state c.
Conclude that the internal energy at state a is equal to the internal energy at state c.
The internal energy at state a and state c are equal.
